item.title: Report E-2024040124
item.description:
Report E-2024040124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, an unknown amount of Dairyland Brand Milkstone Remover and Acid Rinse (Hazardous - UN1760) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS spoke with the service center manager (Tim Dwitt) who requested SDS instructions on cleaning the release. The terminal did not want a contractor out for cleanup and containment. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, (4) 1 gallon poly jugs, and oil-dri will be placed into a 30 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024040111
item.description:
Report E-2024040111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-pound of Copper Metal Powder was released from (1) 3000 lb. super sack due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The remaining material in the damaged super sack was transferred to a new super sack. The released material was collected and placed into (1) 5-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040105
item.description:
Report E-2024040105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSB experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls release from (2) 50-pound paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30 pounds of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of a pallet located on the dock floor due to improper loading/handling. The damaged bags of product, released product, and impacted pallet wood were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040092
item.description:
Report E-2024040092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 4 drums were received on a Bill of Lading. The material was supposed to be paint solids and non-hazardous. Our lab determined that the material was liquid and was paint. The material had a flash point of <140 degrees. The material should've shipped as a hazardous waste ( waste codes D001). Our lab put the shipment on hold. It was determined this was an undeclared waste shipment. A hazardous waste manifest was created for the batch and sent to the customer for signature. The drums were relabeled as hazardous waste and will be handled as such. Customer was notified of all steps to resolve the waste shipment discrepancy

item.title: Report E-2024040050
item.description:
Report E-2024040050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING POST TRIP INSPECTION AFTER ARRIVING AT THE TERMINAL. DRIVER FOUND PRODUCT HAD LEAKED INTO THE CRASH BOX FROM THE PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE. THE PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE WAS REMOVED AND REINSTALLED. PRODUCT WAS CLEANED BY THE TERMINAL PERSONELL. DELIVERY COMPLETED WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT.
